abstracts.cdata!:
The amendment to the Development Credit
            Agreement for the Privatization and Utilities Reform Project
            for Malawi addresses the causes of current slow
            implementation progress, responds to new challenges facing
            the Government of Malawi in parastatal reform, and
            incorporates lessons learned to improve the effectiveness of
            the program. Second it focuses on pre-privatization
            preparatory activities and strengthening of the regulatory
            frameworks for entities already privatized and those
            earmarked for future privatization. Third it reconstitutes
            and strengthens the project Steering Committee, with
            technical oversight delegated to the Ministry of Finance.
            Fourth it reallocates the proceeds of the Credit among
            Disbursement Categories, and increases the disbursement
            percentages to 100 percent for all categories, based on the
            approved country financing parameters for Malawi.
